question.text: What does OOP stand for?
What is a class?
question.answer: An abstract data type with behaviour, and a 'blueprint' for objects.
A file that contains Java source code.
A file that contains Java bytecode.

question.text: What is an object?
Which keyword is used to create a class?
Which keyword is used to create objects?
The class defines the structure of the objects that can be created from it.
We have an object called 'custom', and it has a 'getValue' method. How do we call this method?
We have an object called 'handler', and it has a 'value' member. How do we reference this variable?
Which of these can a class contain?
Class members are initialized to their default values.
Which keyword is used to reference the current object in the methods of the class?
What is overloading?
question.answer: Having multiple classes with the same name.
Having multiple packages with the same name.
Having multiple members with the same name.
Having multiple methods with the same name.

question.text: How are overloaded methods distinguished?
Overloaded methods must have different return types.
Overloaded methods can have different return types.
Overloaded methods must have different parameters.
Which of these are true for constructors?
question.answer: They stand after the new keyword.

question.text: A default constructor is always created.
How many parameters does the default constructor have?
We have a class called 'Complex'. What must be the name of it's constructors?
Which of these are valid visibility classes in Java?
What is encapsulation?
question.answer: The principle of hiding all classes in one package.
Marking all the members of a class private.
The principle of hiding the 'implementation' of a class.

question.text: How many visibility classes are there in Java?
Which visibility class is the 'strictest'? (meaning it's the least visible)
Which visibility class should we use if we want something to be visible only in it's own package?
Which visibility class should we use if we want something to be visible everywhere?
Which visibility class should we use if we want to ensure something is visible inside subclasses?
Which visibility classes can be used on classes?
What is a setter?
question.answer: A class that assigns values to variables.
A method that assigns a value to a member.
A method that returns the value of a hidden member.

question.text: What is polymorphism?
question.answer: Multiple methods can have the same name.
An object can behave like any class that is above him (superclass) in the inheritance hierarchy.
Multiple classes can have the same name.
An object can behave like any class that is below him (subclass) in the inheritance hierarchy.

question.text: Which of these does a subclass inherit from its parent class?
A class can have multiple subclasses.
A class can have multiple superclasses.
Which keyword is used to define inheritance between classes?
Which keyword is used to disable subclassing from a class?
What is overriding?
question.answer: Creating a subclass with the same name.
Redefining a member in a subclass.
Redefining a method in a subclass.

question.text: Which class is at the top of the inheritance hierarchy?
It's possible to make a method non-overridable.
Which keyword is used to call the constructor (or a method) of the superclass?
The call to the superclass' constructor must be the last statement in the subclass' constructor.
Which keyword is used to check the type of an object?
Upcasting is safe.
Downcasting is safe.
What is casting?
question.answer: Changing the type of an object.
Redefining a method in a subclass.
Creating multiple methods with the same name in a class.
Having multiple subclasses for a class.
